Package controller

Class CustomerMenu

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.CustomerMenu
  • public class CustomerMenu
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the Controller for the EditCustomers.fxml form. It is responsible for pulling, creating, updating, deleting customer data from the database.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      CustomerMenu()  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void customerListener​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      The customerListener method waits for a mouse click event in the customerTable, and when an item is pressed it populates the TextFields and ComboBoxes with the appropriate data.
      void initialize()
      initialize pulls data from that database and set's the items in the table.
      void onCustomerAdd​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      When the Add button is pressed this method is called which will take data from the textfields and add it to the database.
      void onCustomerBack​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      When the back button is pressed it will take the user back to the main menu.
      void onCustomerClear​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      When the clear button is pressed, it will clear the text fields and ComboBoxes.
      void onCustomerDelete​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      When the delete button is pressed this method is called and the selected item from the table will be deleted from the customers table, and the subsequent appointments associated with the customer.
      void onCustomerEdit​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      When the save button is pressed it calls this method.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • CustomerMenu

        public CustomerMenu()

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
                throws java.sql.SQLException
        initialize pulls data from that database and set's the items in the table. I use Lambda expressions to populate the ComboBoxes.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • onCustomerAdd

        public void onCustomerAdd​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
                   throws java.sql.SQLException,
                          java.io.IOException
        When the Add button is pressed this method is called which will take data from the textfields and add it to the database. This is done by calling the CustomersQuery insertCustomer() method.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent -
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.io.IOException

      • onCustomerDelete

        public void onCustomerDelete​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        When the delete button is pressed this method is called and the selected item from the table will be deleted from the customers table, and the subsequent appointments associated with the customer. This is done by calling the CustomersQuery delete() method and then calling the AppointmentsQuery delete() method.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent -
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • onCustomerBack

        public void onCustomerBack​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        When the back button is pressed it will take the user back to the main menu.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • onCustomerClear

        public void onCustomerClear​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        When the clear button is pressed, it will clear the text fields and ComboBoxes. I use 2 lambda expressions to repopulate the ComboBoxes.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent -
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • onCustomerEdit

        public void onCustomerEdit​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        When the save button is pressed it calls this method. This method only works if the customerListener method has has been called. This method takes the already populated items and updates the database by calling the CustomerQuery updateCustomer() method.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • customerListener

        public void customerListener​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
        The customerListener method waits for a mouse click event in the customerTable, and when an item is pressed it populates the TextFields and ComboBoxes with the appropriate data. I use lambda expressions for the ComboBoxes.
        Parameters:
        mouseEvent -
